question: The vending machines sell gum for 75 cents and pretzels for 115 cents. Eric spent $10 and got 6 bags of gum and had 9% of his money left in change. How many pretzels did he buy?
answer:
Eric got $0.9 in change because $10*9/100 = <<10*9/100=0.9>>0.9
Eric spent $9.1 because 10 - 0.9 = <<10-0.9=9.1>>9.1
Eric spent $4.5 on gum because 6*0.75 = <<6*0.75=4.5>>4.5
Eric spent 4.6 on pretzels because 9.1 - 4.5 = <<9.1-4.5=4.6>>4.6
Eric bought 4 pretzels because 4.6 / 1.15 = <<4=4>>4
#### 4
